model-value.desc: Model of the component; Must be Array if using 'multiple' prop; Either use this property (along with a listener for 'update:modelValue' event) OR use v-model directive

multiple.desc: Allow multiple selection; Model must be Array

display-value.desc: Override default selection string, if not using 'selected' slot/scoped slot and if not using 'use-chips' prop

display-value-html.desc: Force render the selected option(s) as HTML; This can lead to XSS attacks so make sure that you sanitize the content; Does NOT apply when using 'selected' or 'selected-item' slots!

options.desc: Available options that the user can select from. For best performance freeze the list of options.

option-value.desc: Property of option which holds the 'value'; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

option-label.desc: Property of option which holds the 'label'; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

option-disable.desc: Property of option which tells it's disabled; The value of the property must be a Boolean; If using a function then for best performance, reference it from your scope and do not define it inline

hide-selected.desc: Hides selection; Use the underlying input tag to hold the label (instead of showing it to the right of the input) of the selected option; Only works for non 'multiple' Selects

max-values.desc: Allow a maximum number of selections that the user can do

options-dense.desc: Dense mode for options list; occupies less space

options-dark.desc: Options menu will be colored with a dark color

options-selected-class.desc: CSS class name for options that are active/selected; Set it to an empty string to stop applying the default (which is text-* where * is the 'color' prop value)

options-html.desc: Force render the options as HTML; This can lead to XSS attacks so make sure that you sanitize the content; Does NOT apply when using 'option' slot!

options-cover.desc: Expanded menu will cover the component (will not work along with 'use-input' prop for obvious reasons)

menu-shrink.desc: Allow the options list to be narrower than the field (only in menu mode)

menu-anchor.desc: Two values setting the starting position or anchor point of the options list relative to the field (only in menu mode)

menu-self.desc: Two values setting the options list's own position relative to its target (only in menu mode)

menu-offset.desc: An array of two numbers to offset the options list horizontally and vertically in pixels (only in menu mode)

popup-content-class.desc: Class definitions to be attributed to the popup content

popup-content-style.desc: Style definitions to be attributed to the popup content

use-input.desc: Use an input tag where users can type

use-chips.desc: Use QChip to show what is currently selected

fill-input.desc: Fills the input with current value; Useful along with 'hide-selected'; Does NOT works along with 'multiple' selection

new-value-mode.desc: Enables creation of new values and defines behavior when a new value is added: 'add' means it adds the value (even if possible duplicate), 'add-unique' adds only unique values, and 'toggle' adds or removes the value (based on if it exists or not already); When using this prop then listening for @new-value becomes optional (only to override the behavior defined by 'new-value-mode')

map-options.desc: Try to map labels of model from 'options' Array; has a small performance penalty; If you are using emit-value you will probably need to use map-options to display the label text in the select field rather than the value;  Refer to the 'Affecting model' section above

emit-value.desc: Update model with the value of the selected option instead of the whole option

input-debounce.desc: Debounce the input model update with an amount of milliseconds

input-class.desc: Class definitions to be attributed to the underlying input tag

input-style.desc: Style definitions to be attributed to the underlying input tag

transition-show.desc: Transition when showing the menu/dialog; One of Quasar's embedded transitions

transition-hide.desc: Transition when hiding the menu/dialog; One of Quasar's embedded transitions

transition-duration.desc: Transition duration when hiding the menu/dialog (in milliseconds, without unit)

behavior.desc: Overrides the default dynamic mode of showing as menu on desktop and dialog on mobiles

selected.desc: Override default selection slot; Suggestion: QChip

loading.desc: Override default spinner when component is in loading mode; Suggestion: spinners

before-options.desc: Template slot for the elements that should be rendered before the list of options

after-options.desc: Template slot for the elements that should be rendered after the list of options

no-option.desc: What should the menu display after filtering options and none are left to be displayed; Suggestion: <div>

inputValue.desc: Input textfield value, if any (not QSelect model)

selected-item.desc: Override default selection slot; Suggestion: QChip

opt.desc: Selected option -- its value is taken from model

selected.desc: Always true -- passed down as prop to QItem (when using QItem)

removeAtIndex.desc: Remove selected option located at specific index

index.desc: Index at which to remove selection

tabindex.desc: Tabindex HTML attribute value associated with respective option

option.desc: Customize how options are rendered; Suggestion: QItem

opt.desc: Option -- its value is taken from 'options' prop

itemProps.desc: Computed properties passed down to QItem

input-value.desc: Emitted when the value in the text input changes

remove.desc: Emitted when an option is removed from selection

index.desc: Model index at which removal took place

value.desc: The actual value that was removed

add.desc: Emitted when an option is added to the selection

index.desc: Model index at which addition took place

value.desc: The actual value that was added

new-value.desc: Enables creation of new values; Emitted when a new value has been created; You can override 'new-value-mode' property with it

doneFn.desc: Adds (optional) value to the model; Do not forget to call it after you validate the newly created value; Call it with no parameters if nothing should be added

mode.desc: Override 'new-value-mode' (prop) behavior should you wish to

filter.desc: Emitted when user wants to filter a value

doneFn.desc: Supply a function which makes the necessary updates

callbackFn.desc: Callback to call to make the actual updates

afterFn.desc: Callback to call at the end after the update has been fully processed by QSelect

ref.desc: Vue reference to the QSelect which triggered the filtering

abortFn.desc: Call this function if something went wrong

filter-abort.desc: Emitted when a filtering was aborted; Probably a new one was requested?

popup-show.desc: Emitted when the select options menu or dialog is shown.

popup-hide.desc: Emitted when the select options menu or dialog is hidden.

removeAtIndex.desc: Remove selected option located at specific index

index.desc: Index at which to remove selection

keepOpen.desc: Don't close the menu and do not clear the filter

moveOptionSelection.desc: Move selected option from menu by index offset

offset.desc: Number of options to move up or down

updateInputValue.desc: If 'use-input' is specified, this updates the value that it holds

value.desc: String to set the input value to

noFilter.desc: Set to true if you don't want the filter (if any) to be also triggered

isOptionSelected.desc: Tells if an option is selected

getEmittingOptionValue.desc: Get the model value that would be emitted by QSelect when selecting a said option; Also takes into consideration if 'emit-value' is set

returns.desc: Emitting model value of said option

getOptionValue.desc: Get the model value of an option; Takes into consideration 'option-value' (if used), but does not looks for 'emit-value', like getEmittingOptionValue() does

getOptionLabel.desc: Get the label of an option; Takes into consideration the 'option-label' prop (if used)

isOptionDisabled.desc: Tells if an option is disabled; Takes into consideration 'option-disable' prop (if used)
